conclusion: Shadows are formed when an object blocks a light source, creating a region where the light is not directly visible.
The size and shape of the shadow depend on the position of the light source relative to the object and the surface on which the shadow is cast.
The light source is initially positioned in such a way that it casts shadows A, B, C, and D from the respective objects onto the ground.
The objects are a birdcage, a sword, a chandelier, and a small cone-like object.

premise: When the light source moves backward (away from the objects), the angle at which the light rays hit the objects changes.
conclusion: This change in angle affects both the length and direction of the shadows.

premise: As the light moves backward, the shadow will become shorter because the light rays are hitting the birdcage at a more perpendicular angle.
The direction of the shadow might shift slightly depending on the exact path of the light movement.
conclusion: Shadow A might shift slightly in direction.

premise: Similar to Shadow A, Shadow B will also become shorter as the light source moves backward.
The orientation of the sword might cause the shadow to shift direction slightly.
conclusion: Shadow B might shift slightly in direction.

premise: The shadow of the chandelier will also shorten as the light source moves backward.
The intricate details of the chandelier might cause the shadow to become less elongated and more compact.
conclusion: Shadow C might become less elongated and more compact.

premise: The shadow of the cone-like object will shorten as well.
The circular base of the shadow might become more defined and less stretched.
conclusion: Shadow D might become more defined and less stretched.

premise: The shadows might shift slightly in direction depending on the path of the light source movement, but primarily, they will move closer to their respective objects.
conclusion: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move closer to their respective objects.

premise: All shadows (A, B, C, and D) will become shorter as the light source moves backward.
conclusion: The overall size of each shadow will decrease.

premise: When the light source moves backward, shadows A, B, C, and D will become shorter and may shift slightly closer to their respective objects.
conclusion: The overall size of each shadow will decrease, and the direction might change slightly depending on the movement path of the light source.
